alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rutland County through 515 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rutland, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Proctor, Mendon, Killington, Clarendon, West Rutland, Rutland City, Pittsford, Ira, Chittenden, Shrewsbury, East Pittsford, Clarendon Springs, North Clarendon, Giffords Woods State Forest Park, Center Rutland, North Chittenden and Gifford Woods State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
